name: Begum Khaleda Zia

previous: Prime Minister of Bangladesh (1991-1996, 2001-2006)
Leader of the Opposition (1996-2001, 2008-2014)

political_career.event: Entered active politics after Ziaur Rahman's assassination; became BNP Chairperson in 1984
Served as Prime Minister (three terms, with major policy reforms)
Released; acquitted in remaining cases; nominated for upcoming election

election_constituencies.election_area_name: porshuram Upazila, chagolnaiya upazila, fulgazi upozila

life_activities: Leading BNP, nationwide political mobilization
overall_summary: Begum Khaleda Zia (born 15 August 1945) is the Chairperson of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) and one of the most influential figures in Bangladesh’s modern political history. As the country’s first female Prime Minister, she served three terms between 1991 and 2006, overseeing key democratic transitions after years of military rule. Known for her resilience and mass appeal, she continues to symbolise BNP’s leadership despite health challenges and political restrictions. In recent years, she has been re-nominated to contest from Feni-1, Bogura-7, and Dinajpur-3.

name: Tarique Rahman

previous: Senior Vice Chairman, BNP (2009-2018)

political_career.event: Joined BNP at grassroots (Bogura)
Senior Joint Secretary General, BNP
Assumed role of Acting Chairman

life_activities: Leading party strategy from exile; party mobilisation
overall_summary: Tarique Rahman (born 20 November 1965) is the Acting Chairman of BNP and the eldest son of former President Ziaur Rahman and Begum Khaleda Zia. A key figure in party strategy and organisational reform, he is known for his influence on BNP’s youth base and his role in shaping the party’s digital and overseas presence. Currently living in exile in London, he remains a decisive voice in BNP’s policymaking and has been nominated to contest from Bogura-6.

name: Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir

political_career.event: Elected MP from Thakurgaon-1 (previous terms)
Announced as BNP candidate for Thakurgaon-1

life_activities: Party leadership, campaigning
overall_summary: Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir (born 26 January 1948) is the Secretary General of BNP and a seasoned economist and parliamentarian. With decades of political experience, he has served as one of the party’s principal spokespersons and strategists during times of crisis. Widely respected for his calm and disciplined leadership, Fakhrul represents the party’s moderate reformist wing and has been announced as the BNP candidate for Thakurgaon-1.

name: Salahuddin Ahmed

political_career.event: Elected MP Cox's Bazar-1 (multiple terms)
Named by BNP to contest Cox's Bazar-1

life_activities: national committee work, constituency organisation
overall_summary: Salahuddin Ahmed (born 30 June 1962) is a senior BNP leader and member of the party’s National Standing Committee. A former State Minister and multiple-term Member of Parliament from Cox’s Bazar-1, he has played a significant role in BNP’s national and local-level policy coordination. A lawyer by profession, he continues to be an active organiser in the Chattogram division and has been nominated again for Cox’s Bazar-1.

name: Dr. Khandaker Mosharraf Hossain

political_career.event: Elected MP from Cumilla-2; served ministerial portfolios
Listed among BNP candidates for Cumilla area seats

life_activities: academic turned politician; public health & education policy
overall_summary: Dr. Khandaker Mosharraf Hossain (born 1 October 1946) is a veteran BNP Standing Committee member and an academic-turned-politician. With a PhD in Geology from Imperial College London, he previously served as a cabinet minister in several key departments. Known for his expertise in development policy and governance, Dr. Hossain remains an influential voice in BNP’s policymaking. He is closely associated with Cumilla-2 constituency, representing the Chattogram division.

life_activities: city politics, business philanthropy, party organisation
overall_summary: Mirza Abbas (born 7 February 1951) is a prominent BNP Standing Committee member, businessman, and former Mayor of Dhaka City Corporation. A long-time leader in Dhaka politics, he also served as Minister of Housing and Public Works (2001–2006). His influence extends across both political and business circles, notably as one of the founders of Dhaka Bank. He has been named BNP’s candidate for Dhaka-8 in the upcoming election.

name: Barrister Md. Nowshad Zamir

Trained in law and active in grassroots politics, he represents the new generation of educated professionals entering the party’s ranks. With strong community ties and a reputation for integrity, he has been nominated as BNP’s official candidate for the northern district of Panchagarh.

overall_summary: Farhad Hossain Azad (born 1966) is a BNP leader from Panchagarh, nominated for Panchagarh-2. A lawyer by profession, he has been involved in BNP politics since his student days and previously contested elections from the same seat. Known for his organisational work and close connection with local communities, he continues to play a key role in BNP’s grassroots mobilisation in the Rangpur division.

name: Dr. Abdul Moyeen Khan

political_career.event: MP for Narsingdi-2 and ministerial roles

election_constituencies.election_area_name: Palash and Narsingdi sadar Upazilas union: amdia, pachdona & meherpara union

overall_summary: Dr. Abdul Moyeen Khan (born 1 January 1947) is a senior BNP Standing Committee member, physicist, and former cabinet minister. Educated at the University of Sussex and the University of Dhaka, he served as MP for Narsingdi-2 and held ministerial portfolios in successive BNP governments. His intellectual approach and emphasis on democratic reform make him one of the most respected figures within the party. He is contesting again from Narsingdi-2.

overall_summary: Ishraque Hossain (born 5 April 1987) is a young BNP leader, engineer, and Managing Director of BanglaVision. Educated in the UK, he represents the new generation of urban professionals within BNP. Having previously run for Dhaka South mayor, he is now nominated as BNP’s candidate for Dhaka-6. Known for his modern campaign style and focus on youth inclusion, he has emerged as a prominent figure in Dhaka city politics.

Minister of Commerce

life_activities: party leadership, economic policy
overall_summary: Amir Khasru Mahmud Chowdhury (born 10 November 1949) is a senior BNP Standing Committee member, economist, and former Minister of Commerce. As the founder of the Chittagong Stock Exchange, he played a pioneering role in developing Bangladesh’s financial sector. A respected policymaker, he continues to guide BNP’s economic and trade policy. He represents Chattogram city constituencies and remains an influential figure in national politics.

life_activities: medical advocacy, constituency organisation
overall_summary: Dr. A.Z.M. Zahid Hossain (born 25 December 1960) is a BNP Standing Committee member, physician, and professor of urology. Formerly the personal physician to Begum Khaleda Zia, he has transitioned into an active political organiser, particularly in northern Bangladesh. His dual background in medicine and public service gives him a unique profile within BNP’s senior ranks, and he is currently active in the Dinajpur region.

overall_summary: Major (Retd.) Hafiz Uddin Ahmed (born 29 October 1944) is a decorated war veteran (Bir Bikrom), BNP Standing Committee member, and former Minister of Water Resources and Commerce. Having served multiple terms as MP from Bhola-3, he is known for his disciplined leadership, integrity, and long-standing contribution to Bangladesh’s liberation and political history. He remains an influential figure in Barishal division politics.

overall_summary: Iqbal Hasan Mahmud Tuku (born 1950) is a veteran BNP Standing Committee member and former State Minister of Power and Agriculture. A respected organiser from Sirajganj, he has served in both executive and political capacities. Known for his administrative experience and strong regional base, he remains one of BNP’s trusted policymakers in the Rajshahi division.

overall_summary: Babu Gayeshwar Chandra Roy (born 1 November 1951) is a senior BNP leader and Standing Committee member who represents Bangladesh’s Hindu minority within the party. As a former State Minister for Environment and long-time youth leader, he is known for his fiery speeches and strong stance on national issues. He continues to play an essential role in BNP’s organisational and ideological activities, contesting from Dhaka-3.

A decorated officer turned politician, he has been a key figure in BNP’s Barishal division politics. His leadership reflects a combination of military discipline and political acumen, representing Patuakhali-1 in the upcoming elections.

A practicing lawyer and outspoken parliamentarian, he is known for his strong defence of democratic rights and local governance reforms. His long-standing presence in national politics makes him one of the most influential BNP figures in the Rajshahi division.

A veteran organiser and influential figure in Chattogram division politics, he has contributed significantly to BNP’s economic and trade policy debates. Known for his pragmatic leadership and close grassroots ties, he continues to play an active role in party affairs.

personal_info.address: Resident of Kurigram-1 electoral area (Bhurungamari and Nageshwari Upazilas)

business_income_source_professional_care: Career focused on politics and organizational work for the BNP; no public business or professional details available

political_career.event: Served as General Secretary for Kurigram District BNP
Elected Member of Parliament for Kurigram-1 in the 6th Jatiya Sangsad
Term ended with the dissolution of the 6th Jatiya Sangsad
Contested and lost the subsequent general election for Kurigram-1
Contested and lost general elections for Kurigram-1 as the BNP nominee
Nominated by BNP for the 12th General Election but did not contest due to national boycott
Serving as General Secretary of Kurigram District BNP and coordinating party organization

life_activities: Focused on maintaining BNP’s organizational strength in Kurigram District and persistently contesting the Kurigram-1 parliamentary seat.
overall_summary: Saiful Islam Rana is a veteran BNP leader serving as the General Secretary of Kurigram District BNP. He briefly represented Kurigram-1 in 1996 and has since been the party’s consistent candidate for this seat in multiple elections, demonstrating enduring loyalty and leadership within the BNP.
